entry.title: Paper accepted at CPAIOR 2024
entry.content:
I am happy to let you know that our paper “Core Boosting in SAT-Based Multi-Objective Optimization” has been accepted for publication at the 21st International Conference on the Integration of Constraint Programming, Artificial Intelligence, and Operations Research (CPAIOR) conference.

In the paper, we extend the idea of coore-boosting that I proposed for single-objective optimization in 2019, to the multio-objective setting. We show that core-boosting significantly improves the performance of several state-of-the-art approaches to computing pareto-optimal solutions to multi-objective optimization problems. Once the camera-ready paper is submitted, it will be made available on these webpages as well.

I would like to thank all of my co-authors for their work. Looking forward to going to Uppsala in May.
entry.summary: i.e. the Integration of Constraint Programming, Artificial Intelligence, and Operations Research

entry.title: I Participated in EDUCA
entry.content:
Come find us next to the TIETO scene.

Today and tomorrow I will be representing the meet a researcher initiative of Young Academy of Finland at EDUCA, the largest convention for the education and training sector in Finland.

Meet a researcher connects researchers with schools. We organize remote visits by researchers to different subjects in primary and secondary schools. More than 500 researchers have signed up as voulenteers and currently we are reaching over 10 000 students annually. The best part, it is free for teachers to use. If you are a teacher in Finland (or in a reasonable timezone for Finnish researchers) you should try it. If you’re attending EDUCA tomorrow, you should come say hi.
entry.summary: The largest event for the education and training sector in Finland

entry.title: I was in a podcast on AI

link.title: I was in a podcast on AI

entry.content:
I was interviewed by the Finnish Broadcasting Company (YLE) for their Q&AI podcast about AI. We talked about the (lack of) reliability of AI and what that implies for the future. I had a blast, thanks to Isak Rautio for having me on.

For those of you in Finland, the podcast can be found on YLEs website
